title: The 2016 Oceanic Open Ladder is here!

embed.description: Split two of the Oceanic Open Ladder consists of four ladders and a wildcard tournament! Participate in the ACL, OCE Weekly, Cyber Gamer or Ranked 5's ladder. Pick the tournaments that suit your teams schedule, if your team does well you will earn Riot Point prizes and one of five spots in the Oceanic Challenger Series.

body:
**Hello Summoners!**

Shoutcaster extraordinaire Zack "Rusty" Pye has some information to share about the 2016 OOL.

---


There have been a lot of questions asked and queries thrown around about the Oceanic Open Ladder lately and whether it will continue to be run, well the answer is definitely still a yes!
Now is the time for all aspirational professional LoL players to get your team together, group up and have your shot at the Oceanic Pro Leagues, because it all starts here.

_The week starting the 16th of February, the Oceanic Open Ladder (OOL) will officially commence. Saturdays and Sundays fortnightly the tournaments will take place, providing off weeks for the casual player on weekends. Five tournaments total throughout the league will take us to the Promotion tournament where you can take on the Challenger Series (OCS) teams, to take their place in the first structured league heading to the OPL!_

**The schedule is as follows:**
Week 1 Tournament (Feb 20 ~ Feb 21)
Week 2 Tournament (Mar 5 ~ Mar 6)
Week 3 Tournament (Mar 19 ~ Mar 20)
Week 4 Tournament (Apr 2 ~ Apr 3)
Week 5 Tournament (Apr 16 ~ Apr 17)
Promotion/Relegation Matches (Apr 25 ~ May 1)

**Where can I sign up?**
Your path to pro starts right here on Battlefy: [OOL Week 1!](https://battlefy.com/riot-games-oceanic-open-ladder)

**Day 1 (Preliminaries)** will see a round robin tournament with varying sizes, dependant on signups. The reason behind this is to provide an opportunity for all teams entering to garner experience in a competitive environment, familiarising themselves with day long competition. If they were to succeed and make it towards the OCS, this practice will prove vital moving into a league structure. The round robin will see approximately 4 games played between groups, with the top 2 teams from each group succeeding into Playoffs.
**Day 2 (Playoffs)** of competition will be a single elimination bracket with best of 1 play up until the finals run which will break off into a best of 3 format. With the first day providing maximum player experience and opportunity to show off your skill, playoffs narrows the pack down to the find the absolute highest performing teams to challenge the top of the ladder. 

The ladder will be concurrent with the league and a constantly updated system where your placement in both days will prove vital. The points will reward both consistent entry into the fortnightly tournaments and results in the same tournaments, slightly favoured towards results (as you’d expect).

An example of how the ladder looks will be added to the [Website for OOL](http://oce.lolesports.com/leagues/oceanic-open-ladder) as the weeks commence!

**How do the points work?**
Basically the system will be rewarding placement and consistently in near equal amounts, inclined towards results to promote those aspirational competitive teams. We provide points for the preliminary results, varying in equal amounts from 1st to 4th in each respective group. This leads into playoff points which are weighted more heavily for results.

**Preliminaries (Day 1) Points**
1st - 20 points
2nd - 15 points 
3rd - 10 points
4th - 5 points
5th - 0 points

**Playoffs (Day 2) Points**
1st Place  - 90 points
2nd place - 60 points
3rd Place - 40 points 
4th Place - 30 points
5th - 8th Place - 20 points 
9th - 16th Place - 10 points 
17th - 32th Place - 5 points

**Who can join?**
The question isn’t who, but why! The Oceanic Open Ladder is your path to pro league, whilst we have no restrictions on joining, it’s in yours and your team's best interest to be willing to learn & improve from every respective OOL event. We welcome all entries who wish to take their craft as far as possible, but unfortunately due to the best possible player experience, we have to cap the total signups at 160 teams, so get in fast!

**Prizes?**
Quite simply, yes there will be RP prizes for every individual event, without a larger one for final placement. We are focusing on rewarding consistency as mentioned earlier, we want teams to commit and show that they can continue to commit through to a league format that is the OCS.
Prizes are as follows:

**RP & PRIZES FOR STANDINGS (Per Player)**
1st Place - Triumphant Ryze & 3200 RP
2nd Place - 2800 RP
3rd Place - 2100 RP
4th Place - 1100 RP
5th - 8th Place - 800 RP
9th - 16th Place - 500 RP
17th - Last - 0 RP

For those who wish to get into the nitty gritty of the OOL and suss out the ruleset, we have them ready to go and in place here! 
Standout feature: Maximum 160 teams due to optimal player experience and aforementioned tournament structure.

You can find the [**OOL Rules here!**](http://news.cdn.leagueoflegends.com.s3.amazonaws.com/public/riot-oce/2016OOLRulesv1.0.pdf)

**Will there be a broadcast and how can I get involved?**
One last thing that should be of interest to a select few is the ability to shoutcast or produce the OOL! At present we have a form for you to fill out, this form will be your expression of interest towards casting the OOL officially. Though we don’t have any restrictions on the league being casted from third party sources, we do however offer a lot of benefits to those who opt into the form and getting designated casts through us here. Fill out the below form, we will try and create collaborations and set up as many casting avenues as possible. It’s always preferred and better for broadcasts to have at least 2 casters involved for. The broadcast will be a ‘bedroom cast’ format, casual and only the passionate and willing need apply!

[**Caster Application Form!**](http://goo.gl/forms/2nVaFXZBPQ)

The reason we’ve decided to have casting applications is to find, develop and nurture local talent to be the best they can be! With every event we wish to put the best foot forward, this is the perfect opportunity to do so. You’re welcome to host your own stream but it’s very easy to find direction as the nominated go-to source for OOL action. It’s also a place we can direct viewers on each week as you get to work with tournament admins and actively find new games to broadcast throughout!

If you’ve got any questions about the schedule, how to enter, rulings or something you believe I may have missed in this post, just leave a comment below.

Otherwise thanks a bunch and I look forward to seeing your team take their shot at OPL fame!

Cheers,
Rusty.
---
Rusty is standing by to answer any questions you might have, so fire away!

-- Marowi

replies.body: Really interested in the casting side of this, hopefully can get involved and put some advice given to me to good use!
Glad to hear it, make sure that forms filled out and good to go!
Will we get some sort of confirmation that it's gone through at all?

Confirmation that it's gone through unfortunately not via an email of any sorts just yet. I'll be personally seeing the forms through though and hopefully emailing as a receipt as such to provide awareness!

A fair concern so thankyou for bringing it up.

@Rusty

Hey Rusty,
Just wondering, since the OOL is starting this weekend, 
when can we expect to hear back from you guys with regards to whether or not we have been chosen to cast the OOL?

Regards
~Shanang

Hey mate, just a small update for you - hoping to be tomorrow! It will be done (decisions on casting talent) on a bi-weekly basis however as we wish to give as many people possible a chance to experience OOL casting!
Awesome! :D
what level do you have to be as im only level 5 at the moment {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

>

There are no requirements to play in the tournament, But you need to have enough champions to play tournament draft which is 16 champions. including free weekly champions.

BoL!

Hey I just registered my team 
Question: When signing in do the whole team need to sign in or just the team captain?
Question: Will we see brackets and the schedule when the tourney begins?

Check-In should be just the captain, but better safe than sorry right? :P

You will see brackets and schedule when the tourny begins yes.
Best of luck in your OOL adventures!
Thanks :3

Rusty, I have a few questions regarding casting the OOL:

1. Are you looking for casters who will stream on an official Riot Games channel? Or do you anticipate broadcasts on community channels but you guys will be involved in mentoring/some other capacity?
2. Either way, to what extent will production value be controlled by Riot? As in, will you be issuing overlays, scene structures etc? Or will we still be putting together our own overlays  etc?
2a. To what extent will we be able to feature our own graphics? For example, will a community organisation be able to feature their logo on stream? Will we be able to feature our own sponsor's logos on stream?
3.  How will access to matches work? Will Riot allocate matches, or will it be a matter of knowing when they happen and just spectating to stream, or some other method?
3a. Will there be a match quota to meet, for e.g. "you need to do x matches per week". And will there be any mandatory scheduling, for e.g. "We need you to stream every Monday from 7pm onwards for the next x weeks"
4.  To what extent can we be a "packaged deal"? We have a producer and 2 casters that are keen to work together - will we be able to or will Riot be assigning casting teams that might split us up?

Thanks.

1. Casters will be broadcasting on their personal channels/producer channels. We won't necessarily be involved with mentoring unless time permits, I'll be trying my best to provide active and retrospective feedback but it isn't something I can appropriately promise!

2. a) I'm trying to get overlays and other assorted things put into effect, but until you see them assume they aren't available and non-essential to the broadcast. You can utilize all of your own stuff, as per your desire.
    b) Absolutely you can advertise your own brand. Just make sure you're advertising your brand ON the OOL, not your brand featuring the OOL, use common sense and you'll find a very happy medium, I trust you.

3. I will be designating a broadcaster for the weekened/day of the weekend, they will work with admins and find games where available, or you are more then able to find, you can ideally find fresh matches but you're more than welcome to join games in progress, again as per your preference.
a) No quota to meet, it's all on your capaibilities, if you're broadcast it would make the most sense to fit as much of the day in as possible. If I had to choose, you'd be getting all of day 2 but day 1 is flexible.

4. The caster form above has plenty of information regarding your roles and preferences as a casting team, if you're a team you are more than welcome to stay as a team. We won't split people up that have these preference and as long as you ensure the preferences are included in the forms, you should be fine!

Cheers

Hey Rusty 
Can u please explain to me what the producer actaully does?
Id b interested in the shout caster role but have no idea what the options mean which probs mean im not right for the role any way haha
Thanks

Producer runs around the back end, usually is the one pressing buttons to go onto a break screen and put graphics/overlays up, the other thing particular to the OOL is that the **producer is the streamer**! To give focus entirely to casting for the casters.
